snippet.title: Install Anaconda Python, Jupyter Notebook And Spyder on Windows 10
snippet.description:
🐍 In this Video I am going to show How to Down and install Anaconda (Python distribution) on your Windows 10 operating system. So what is Anaconda ? Anaconda is a free and open source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for data science and machine learning related applications. It can be installed on Windows, Linux, and MacOS.Conda is an open source, cross-platform,  package management system. Anaconda comes with so very nice tools like: JupyterLab, Jupyter Notebook,
QtConsole, Spyder, Glueviz, Orange, Rstudio, Visual Studio Code.

I will also show How to use Jupyter Notebook and How to use Spyder using Anaconda.

snippet.title: Jupyter Notebook Tutorial: Introduction, Setup, and Walkthrough
snippet.description:
In this Python Tutorial, we will be learning how to install, setup, and use Jupyter Notebooks. Jupyter Notebooks have become very popular in the last few years, and for good reason. They allow you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations and markdown text. This can all be run from directly in the browser. It is an essential tool to learn if you are getting started in Data Science, but will also have tons of benefits outside of that field. Let's get started.

snippet.title: Jupyter Installation für Python mit Anaconda Distribution [Mac/Windows/Linux] - Tutorial (deutsch)
snippet.description:
In diesem Video schauen wir uns gemeinsam an, wie wir die Jupyter Umgebung mit ihren Jupyter Notebooks über die Anaconda Distribution auf unserem eigenen System installieren. So können wir bspw. Python oder R Skripte in der Jupyter Umgebung erstellen, ausführen und verwalten.

Diese Anleitung wurde auf einem MacBook Pro aufgezeichnet, lässt sich aber auf alle Mac, Windows und Linux Systeme übertragen.


KOMPLETTE VIDEO KURS SERIE

Dieses Video ist Teil des Udemy-Kurses "Das Originale Python Bootcamp", der seinen Studenten den Umgang mit Python beibringt. Es werden sowohl ein grundlegender Einstieg in die Programmierung und Python-Sprache geboten, als auch weiterführende Anwendungsfälle mit bspw. Map- und Reduce-Funktionen.


EXKLUSIVER RABATT FÜR YOUTUBE ZUSCHAUER

90% Rabatt auf alle unsere Kurse für Youtube-Abonnenten und Zuschauer:

► Original Python Bootcamp: https://goo.gl/4rVhuX
► Python für Data Science & Machine Learning: https://goo.gl/9r9j7x
► R für Data Science & Machine Learning: https://goo.gl/S8WYjY


WEITERE RESSOURCEN

► Anaconda Download: https://goo.gl/ZJwV5A
► Jupyter Webseite: https://goo.gl/xtHZJW
► Try Jupyter: https://goo.gl/9ZYRLb


KONTAKT

► Datamics Webseite: https://goo.gl/4QE8gR
► Udemy Profil: https://goo.gl/DVYStJ



SCHRIFTLICHE ANLEITUNG

1. Geht auf die Jupyter Webseite (jupyter.org)
2. Scrollt ggf. nach unten und klickt auf den Install the Notebook Button
3. Der Button bringt euch zur Installationsanleitung.
4. Und diese weist euch an, zur Anaconda Installationsseite zu gehen. Als Download könnt ihr den Graphical Installer für euer passendes Betriebssystem wählen.
5. Folgt den Anweisungen des Graphical Insallers, den ihr gewählt habt. Es sollte selbsterklärend sein, wie bei anderer Software auch. Ihr könnt die Standardeinstellungen unverändert übernehmen.
6. Sobald ihr Anaconda erfolgreich heruntergleaden und installiert habt könnt ihr mit den installationsanweisungen für Jupyter fortfahren. Alle Installationen sollten im Terminal (für Mac und Linux) bzw. der Kommandozeile (für Windows) durchgeführt werden. Mac Nutzer können in der Spotlight Suche nach terminal suchen. Windows Nutzer erreichen die Kommandozeile durch pwershell oder cmd in der Windows Suche.
7. Sobald die Installation abgeschlossen ist, tippt jupyter notebook im Terninal / in der Kommandozeile ein.
8. Es sollte sich jetzt ein neuer Tab im Browser öffnen. Darin könnt ihr damit beginnen Jupyter Notebooks zu nutzen. Keine Sorge falls der Tab etwas sagt wie "Conda [Root]" oder "Python Default", beide dieser Optionen werden funktionieren. Klickt sie an,  um zu starten.
9. Für mehr Informationen darüber, wie man die Jupyter Notebooks nutzen kann, schaut euch die anderen Lektionen in dieser Sektion an.
10. Für weitere Informationen zum Jupyter Notebook System schaut in die offizielle Dokumentation.

snippet.title: Installing Jupyter notebook on windows 10
snippet.description:
This video is about how to install and setup anaconda for working on jupyter notebooks.

Anaconda is a great choice for anyone using Python, especially if you are beginner or want to learn data science.

When you install Anaconda, you will have tons of packages and libraries.

With Anaconda, you’ll get Jupyter Notebooks which become very popular in the last few years, for a reason. With Jupyter Notebooks you’ll be able to write code and instantly see how it works, to create and share documents with code, equations and beautiful visualizations all at one place. Also, you can write text and create markdowns and use your code for different presentations. And this can all be run directly from your browser                   

Install Anaconda : https://anaconda.org/

snippet.title: 01 Install and Setup Apache Spark 2.2.0 Python in Windows - PySpark
snippet.description:
Apache Spark for Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning is available now (link below).
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VAE0wEaYXHs&list=PLkRkKTC6HZMxAPWIqXp2bnQI_UFd0YsbC

Install and Setup Apache Spark 2.2.0 Python in Windows - PySpark
** Support by following this channel:) **

New windows environments:
1. HADOOP_HOME = C:\spark\hadoop
2. JAVA_HOME = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_151
3. SCALA_HOME = C:\spark\scala\bin
4. SPARK_HOME = C:\spark\spark\bin
PYSPARK_PYTHON = C:\Users\user\Anaconda3\envs\python.exe
5. PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON = C:\Users\user\Anaconda3\envs\Scripts\jupyter.exe
6. PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON_OPTS = notebook

No 2,4,5, you can change regarding your own path locations.

Best,
Ardian

snippet.title: How to install Julia and Jupyter notebooks
snippet.description:
In this video, I show you how to install Julia, install the Anaconda Distribution to get Jupyter notebooks, and install the Julia package IJulia, which will allow you to run Julia from within a Jupyter notebook.

Alternatively, you could simply install Julia and IJulia, without ever installing Anaconda. In this case, IJulia will install Jupyter via Miniconda. When you do it this way, Jupyter is not added to your PATH by default, so you’ll have to add it to be able to run the command `jupyter notebook` from the command line.

localized.title: How to install Julia and Jupyter notebooks

snippet.title: Anaconda, Tensorflow, Keras Installation on Windows
snippet.description:
#Anaconda #Keras #TensorFlow #Windows #SetUp

In this tutorial, we will set up our environment for implementing deep learning algorithms like CNN, RNN etc. 

We will start with Installing Anaconda (Python, Jupyter, Spyder), and then tensorflow and then Keras.

Anaconda is a package which comes with python and most of the libraries needed for data science.  It also comes with conda and pip which help us install other libraries with ease. It comes with Anaconda Python, Jupyter notebook, and Spyder IDE which come in a lot handy.

Tensorflow is google's own machine learning platform built by their own engineers. 

Keras is a Deep Learning Library which has been quite popular these days. We use models of Deep Learning with python. 

We will look at many other applications of deep learning and use Python to implement them with the help of Keras with tensorflow backend. 

All the codes will be available at Github: https://github.com/shreyans29/thesemicolon
Follow us on FB : https://www.facebook.com/thesemicolon.code
Support us on Patreon : https://www.patreon.com/thesemicolon

Deep Learning Book From the experts : http://amzn.to/2nXweQS
Recommended book for Deep Learning : http://amzn.to/2nXweQS

snippet.title: PySpark Installation | Configure Jupyter Notebook with PySpark | PySpark Tutorial | Edureka
snippet.description:
** PySpark Certification Training: https://www.edureka.co/pyspark-certification-training **
This Edureka video on PySpark Installation will provide you with step by step installation of PySpark on a Linux Environment. This video is on CentOs but the steps are the same for Ubuntu as well. It will also provide you with the hardware as well as the software requirements for the installation. This video covers the following topics:

1.Hardware Requirements
2. Software Requirements
3. Installation Process
4. PySpark Demo

-------------------------------------------

About the Course

Edureka’s PySpark Certification Training is designed to provide you with the knowledge and skills that are required to become a successful Spark Developer using Python and prepare you for the Cloudera Hadoop and Spark Developer Certification Exam (CCA175). Throughout the PySpark Training, you will get an in-depth knowledge of Apache Spark and the Spark Ecosystem, which includes Spark RDD, Spark SQL, Spark MLlib and Spark Streaming. You will also get comprehensive knowledge of Python Programming language, HDFS, Sqoop, Flume, Spark GraphX and Messaging System such as Kafka.

----------------------------------------------

    Spark Certification Training is designed by industry experts to make you a Certified Spark Developer. The PySpark Course offers:

    Overview of Big Data & Hadoop including HDFS (Hadoop Distributed File System), YARN (Yet Another Resource Negotiator)
    Comprehensive knowledge of various tools that fall in Spark Ecosystem like Spark SQL, Spark MlLib, Sqoop, Kafka, Flume and Spark Streaming
    The capability to ingest data in HDFS using Sqoop & Flume, and analyze those large datasets stored in the HDFS
    The power of handling real-time data feeds through a publish-subscribe messaging system like Kafka
    The exposure to many real-life industry-based projects which will be executed using Edureka’s CloudLab
    Projects which are diverse in nature covering banking, telecommunication, social media, and government domains
    Rigorous involvement of an SME throughout the Spark Training to learn industry standards and best practices

---------------------------------------------------

Who should go for this course?

The market for Big Data Analytics is growing tremendously across the world and such a strong growth pattern followed by market demand is a great opportunity for all IT Professionals. Here are a few Professional IT groups, who are continuously enjoying the benefits and perks of moving into the Big Data domain.

    Developers and Architects
    BI /ETL/DW Professionals
    Senior IT Professionals
    Mainframe Professionals
    Freshers
    Big Data Architects, Engineers and Developers
    Data Scientists and Analytics Professionals


-------------------------------------------------------

There are no such prerequisites for Edureka’s PySpark Training Course. However, prior knowledge of Python Programming and SQL will be helpful but is not at all mandatory.

--------------------------------------------------------

snippet.title: Install Anaconda Python, Jupyter Notebook And Spyder on Mac
snippet.description:
🐍 In this Video I am going to show How to Down and install Anaconda (Python distribution) on your Mac OS X operating system. So what is Anaconda ? Anaconda is a free and open source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for data science and machine learning related applications. It can be installed on Windows, Linux, and MacOS.Conda is an open source, cross-platform,  package management system. Anaconda comes with so very nice tools like: JupyterLab, Jupyter Notebook,
QtConsole, Spyder, Glueviz, Orange, Rstudio, Visual Studio Code.

I will also show How to use Jupyter Notebook and How to use Spyder using Anaconda.
Install Jupyter Notebook on mac, Mac OS X, macOS
Install Spyder on mac, Mac OS X & macOS

Anaconda is a free and open source distribution of the Python and R programming languages for data science and machine learning related applications. snippet.title: Installations for Deep Learning: Anaconda, Jupyter Notebook, Tensorflow, Keras | Keras #2
snippet.description:
Link to download anaconda - https://www.anaconda.com/download/

Create environment ([EnvironmentName] takes place of your environment's name) for Mac and PC -

conda create -n [EnvironmentName]

Activate environment for Mac -

source activate [EnvironmentName]

Activate environment for PC - 

activate [EnvironmentName]

Install Tensorflow for Mac and PC -

conda install tensorflow

Install Keras for Mac and PC - 

conda install Keras

Install nb_conda for Mac and PC - 

conda install nb_conda

Launch jupyter notebook for Mac and PC - 

jupyter notebook

**********

In this video, I show how to set up the basic tools that I will be using in future videos for deep learning. These tools include Anaconda (which includes Conda, Jupyter Notebook, and Python), Tensorflow, Keras, and nb_conda (this package allows us to switch environments in Jupyter Notebook and is necessary, in my testing, for everything to work properly).

snippet.title: Setting up Python for machine learning: scikit-learn and Jupyter Notebook
snippet.description:
Want to get started with machine learning in Python? I'll discuss the pros and cons of the scikit-learn library, show how to install my preferred Python distribution, and demonstrate the basic functionality of the Jupyter Notebook. If you don't yet know any Python, I'll also provide four recommended resources for learning Python.

Download the notebook: https://github.com/justmarkham/scikit-learn-videos
Six reasons why I recommend scikit-learn: http://radar.oreilly.com/2013/12/six-reasons-why-i-recommend-scikit-learn.html
API design for machine learning software: http://arxiv.org/pdf/1309.0238v1.pdf
Should you teach Python or R for data science?: https://www.dataschool.io/python-or-r-for-data-science/

snippet.title: How to install Anaconda Jupyter and Spyder
snippet.description:
Steps:-
1.Go to Download Anaconda
2.Based on your Operating System Click on WindowS or Mac or Linux Symbol
3.Download Python 3.5 Version for 64 bit or 32 bit. Right Click on “My Computer” and go to Properties
4.Search for Anaconda Prompt and open it
5.Type the below commands to update conda and Jupyter
6.
#Update conda
conda update conda

#Update Jupyter
conda update jupyter

#install packages
conda install numpy
conda install pandas
conda install statsmodels

conda install matplotlib
conda install seaborn


#To Open Jupyter notebook from Anaconda Prompt, type
jupyter notebook

#To Open Spyder from Anaconda Prompt, type
start Spyder
7. Jupyter notebook can run R Codes also

 type the below code

conda install -c r r-essentials
8.Thank You


Download Links:-
Anaconda: https://www.anaconda.com/download/

snippet.title: 02 Setup Jupyter Notebook for Apache Spark
snippet.description:
Setup Jupyter Notebook for Apache Spark
** Support by following this channel:) **

New windows environments:
1. HADOOP_HOME = C:\spark\hadoop
2. JAVA_HOME = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_151
3. SCALA_HOME = C:\spark\scala\bin
4. SPARK_HOME = C:\spark\spark\bin
5. PYSPARK_PYTHON = C:\Users\user\Anaconda3\envs\python.exe
6. PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON = C:\Users\user\Anaconda3\envs\Scripts\jupyter.exe
7. PYSPARK_DRIVER_PYTHON_OPTS = notebook
8. Add "C:\spark\spark\bin” to variable “Path” Windows.

No 2,4,5, you can change regarding your own path locations.

Best,
Ardian

snippet.title: #2 Python Tutorials in Hindi | How to Install Jupyter Notebook in Python
snippet.description:
#2 Python Tutorials in Hindi | How to Install Jupyter Notebook in Python

Installing Jupyter Notebook on windows Linux or MAC with PIP.

►►Prerequisite: Python
While Jupyter runs code in many programming languages, Python is a requirement (Python 3.3 or greater, or Python 2.7) for installing the Jupyter Notebook itself.

►►Installing Jupyter with pip
As an existing or experienced Python user, you may wish to install Jupyter using Python’s package manager, pip, instead of Anaconda.

►►If you have Python 3 installed (which is recommended):

python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip
python3 -m pip install jupyter

►►If you have Python 2 installed:

python -m pip install --upgrade pip
python -m pip install jupyter

jupyter notebook
